item.title: Vontobel completes acquisition of client book from IHAG Privatbank
item.description:
From: Media releases and news

The acquisition of IHAG’s client book, announced on September 19, 2024, strengthens Vontobel’s presence in the DACH region. IHAG clients have been integrated in Vontobel’s Private Clients segment, benefiting from Vontobel’s extensive global investment expertise, professional advice, and digital capabilities.

(“lastminute.com”), the European Travel-Tech leader in Dynamic Holiday Packages (DP), today announces its Q4 and preliminary FY 2024 unaudited figures in line with guidance. The Group’s core product, Dynamic Holiday Packages, continues to be a key driver of growth and a valuable contributor to overall revenue and marginality.

item.description:
From: Schlatter Industries AG

Dieses positive Ergebnis unterstreicht unser Engagement für höchste Qualitäts- und Managementstandards. Dank der kontinuierlichen Arbeit und dem Einsatz unseres Teams können wir unseren Kunden und Partnern auch in Zukunft erstklassige Leistungen und verlässliche Prozesse gewährleisten. Wir sind stolz darauf, unsere Position als führender Anbieter in der Branche weiter zu festigen.

item.title: Geschäftsbericht 2024
item.description:
From: Plazza

Der Geschäftsbericht ist online und kann heruntergeladen werden. Hinweis zu möglichen zukunftsgerichteten Aussagen: Der vorliegende Geschäftsbericht der PLAZZA AG enthält möglicherweise zukunftsgerichtete Aussagen. Diese können an Ausdrücken wie «sollen», «annehmen», «erwarten», «rechnen mit», «beabsichtigen», «anstreben», «zukünftig» oder ähnlichen Ausdrücken sowie der Diskussion von Strategien, Zielen, Plänen oder Absichten usw. erkennbar sein. Sie unterliegen bekannten oder unbekannten Risiken […]

item.title: WEG Takes Warehouse Automation to the Next Level with Kardex’ AutoStore Solution
item.description:
From: KR-EN News

May 2025 – Duluth, Georgia, U.S. – WEG, a global leader in industrial electrical solutions, has announced a strategic partnership with Kardex, a premier provider of AutoStoreTM solutions, to transform its storage and order fulfillment processes. By integrating AutoStore’s high-density automated storage and retrieval system (ASRS), WEG aims to enhance operational efficiency, improve inventory accuracy, and optimize space utilization.

Next-Level Automation for Efficiency & Growth

WEG is committed to operational excellence, sustainability, and continuous innovation. The company sought an advanced automation solution to optimize product handling, storage efficiency, and picking accuracy while ensuring faster and more reliable service for its customers.

With a diverse product portfolio including drives, controls, automation components, motors, and parts, WEG needed a solution that could efficiently store and manage a vast range of inventory. AutoStore’s fully automated modular and flexible design makes it an ideal fit, offering space-saving, scalable, and high-speed order fulfillment capabilities while ensuring seamless inventory tracking and reduced operational bottlenecks. The system’s high-density, cube-based scalable design will significantly increase warehouse efficiency, allowing WEG to store up to four times more inventory within the same footprint while ensuring faster and more precise order fulfillment. 

Why Kardex? The Ideal AutoStore Integration Partner


Selecting the right AutoStore integrator was a critical decision for WEG, ensuring a seamless transition to automation while maximizing operational efficiency. With AutoStore's direct recommendation, Kardex emerged as the trusted partner due to its deep expertise in intralogistics automation and its ability to deliver tailored, future-ready solutions.

Kardex’ approach goes beyond simply implementing automation. It customizes each AutoStore system to meet the unique needs of its clients. Through advanced simulation technology, Kardex ensures that every installation is optimized for maximum efficiency and performance. Additionally, the modular design of Kardex-integrated AutoStore solutions allows businesses like WEG to scale their automation capabilities as demand grows, ensuring long-term adaptability.

Antonio Fernando Rodrigues, Vice President of Operations at WEG,emphasized the importance of this investment:"WEG is dedicated to providing exceptional service to our customers. We actively seek customer feedback and implement solutions to enhance their experience. Our goal is to invest in the latest technology for automated inventory management, which will improve operational performance and inventory accuracy. This investment also empowers our employees to deliver their best work every day and contributes to our sustainability goals."

item.title: Kardex Selected to Deliver AutoStore Solution for Alfa Laval’s New U.S. Distribution Center
item.description:
From: KR-EN News

May 2025 – Indianapolis, Indiana, U.S. – Kardex, a global AutoStore partner and leader in intralogistics automation, has been selected by Alfa Laval to implement a cutting-edge AutoStore solution at its newly constructed 324,000-square-foot facility in Indianapolis, Indiana. The partnership supports Alfa Laval’s strategic expansion in North America, strengthening its ability to deliver faster, more sustainable aftersales service and spare parts fulfillment to customers across the United States.

 

Strategic Expansion to Meet Market Demand

Headquartered in Lund, Sweden, Alfa Laval is a global leader in heat transfer, separation, and fluid handling technologies, serving the energy, marine, and food and water sectors. The new Indianapolis facility, located in the County Line Commerce industrial park is designed to expand operational capacity, improve training and testing capabilities, and meet growing customer demand. It forms part of a broader North American growth strategy that also includes recent investments in Greer, South Carolina.

 

With its existing distribution center at capacity and reliant on a traditional two-aisle mini-load system requiring frequent maintenance, Alfa Laval sought a scalable, energy-efficient solution to modernize its spare parts fulfillment. We evaluated and chose the best-fit technology, ultimately identifying AutoStore as the optimal platform to support long-term operational and financial goals.

 

Automating for Growth, Accuracy, and Flexibility

The Kardex-designed AutoStore system will automate the handling of small spare parts across a range of core functions, including inbound putaway, lot and batch-controlled storage, kitting, order picking, and cycle counting. Engineered for speed and space efficiency, the system is expected to process over 350 bin presentations per hour, ensuring rapid order fulfillment and full operational support for the next 15 years.

 

System Benefits and Features:

  • High-density storage that consolidates inventory in a compact footprint
  • FIFO/FEFO inventory rotation and full lot/batch traceability
  • Flexible port configuration for unified inbound, outbound, and inventory processes
  • Real-time prioritization of urgent outbound orders and “make-to-order” workflows
  • Labor efficiency through automation of repetitive inventory and picking tasks

 

The solution not only boosts operational performance but supports Alfa Laval’s commitment to sustainability. The Indianapolis facility incorporates smart building design, heat pump systems, and energy recovery, operating with the goal of reducing carbon emissions by 95% and aligning with Alfa Laval’s 2030 sustainability targets.

 

Strong Partnership Grounded in Innovation

"Kardex is proud to partner with Alfa Laval on this landmark project," said Mitch Hayes, President of Kardex Solutions. "From the beginning, our teams aligned around a common vision to future-proof Alfa Laval’s intralogistics operations while ensuring reliability, flexibility, and long-term scalability. This solution is a testament to the power of intelligent automation in supporting service excellence and growth."

 

PerA Sanberg, Vice President Operations, Head of Parts, Distribution and Logistics, added: "The AutoStore system will be a cornerstone of our new facility. Kardex brought not only the right technology, but the right mindset. Their partnership throughout the process helped us design a solution that meets our current needs and positions us for long-term growth, customer responsiveness, and operational efficiency."

 

About Kardex

Kardex is a leading global partner for intralogistics solutions in an attractive and growing market. The Group offers premium automated products, standardized systems, and lifecycle services that guarantee high availability and low total cost of ownership. Kardex provides an intelligent entry into automation with its dynamic storage and retrieval systems, offers integrated material handling systems, small parts storage systems, and automated high-bay warehouses, and acts as a global AutoStore partner, offering flexible and modular storage and order fulfillment solutions. The Group employs around 2,500 people in over 30 countries. Kardex Holding AG has been listed on the SIX Swiss Exchange since 1989. For more information, visit www.kardex.com.

About Alfa Laval
The ability to make the most of what we have is more important than ever. Together with our customers, we're innovating the industries that society depends on and creating lasting positive impact. We're set on helping billions of people to get the energy, food, and clean water they need. And, at the same time, we're decarbonizing the marine fleet that's the backbone of global trade.

We pioneer technologies and solutions that free our customers to unlock the true potential of resources. As our customers' businesses grow stronger, the goal of a truly sustainable world edges closer. The company is committed to optimizing processes, creating responsible growth, and driving progress to support customers in achieving their business goals and sustainability targets. Together, we're pioneering positive impact.

 

Alfa Laval was founded 140 years ago, has customers in 100 countries, employs more than 22,300 people, and annual sales were SEK 66.6 billion (5.8 BEUR) in 2024. The company is listed on Nasdaq Stockholm. www.alfalaval.us

item.title: Metzger Autoteile Collaborates with Kardex Mlog to Build Logistics Center
item.description:
From: KR-EN News

Family-owned Metzger Autoteile, based in southern Germany, commissioned Kardex Mlog as general contractor to build an automated, five-aisle high-bay warehouse with approximately 6,000 pallet storage spaces and an AutoStore plant with some 80,000 bins. The large-scale project also includes extensive conveying technology for pallets and bins, several picking stations, and complete control of the overall plant via the Kardex Control Center warehouse management system. At the request of the customer, the software will not only manage the new plant sections but will fully replace the existing control system. Kardex Mlog worked together with Metzger Autoteile to come up with the concept for the new logistics center. With some 200 employees, the company is one of the largest employers in Filderstadt. The extension, which is to be carried out on a site of approximately 10,000 square meters, will provide Metzger Autoteile with additional capacity for further growth. The new logistics center in the Filder-Airport Areal in Filderstadt is scheduled for completion by September 2026.

item.description:
From: KR-EN News

March 2025 – Chicago, IL – Appearing at ProMat 2025, a manufacturing and supply chain show, this month, Kardex Solutions and Paccurate are proud to announce a strategic partnership aimed at transforming warehouse efficiency through the integration of intelligent cartonization into Kardex’ FulfillX software ecosystem. The collaboration brings together Kardex’ expertise in warehouse automation with Paccurate’s advanced packaging optimization technology to reduce shipping costs, minimize material waste, and improve overall fulfillment efficiency. Visit both companies at ProMat 2025

item.title: Hans-Jürgen Heitzer hands over management responsibility to Winnie Ahrens
item.description:
From: KR-EN News

The leadership structure at Kardex Mlog is changing step by step as part of a planned generational switch. On 31 December 2025, Hans-Jürgen Heitzer, who has led the Business Unit since 2011, will relinquish his role as Head of Kardex Mlog. To ensure continuity and to enable a seamless passing of the baton, Mr Heitzer will remain with the company in an advisory capacity until his retirement at the end of 2026.

item.title: WEBER-HYDRAULIK: Refurbished in just 3 weeks
item.description:
From: KR-EN News

In just three weeks, Kardex completed the refurbishment of a two-aisle, high-bay warehouse at the headquarters of the family-owned WEBER-HYDRAULIK in Güglingen, Baden-Württemberg. The warehouse serves as buffer storage for the production area. The project included the replacement of two stacker cranes and the refurbishment of the conveying technology with two transfer carriages as well as five height-adjustable picking stations and two weighing terminals. In addition, a material flow system with customized design was installed.

item.title: Amwittools Expands Further with Three New Kardex Shuttles and Visual Order Picking System
item.description:
From: KR-EN News

Ter Aar, July 2025 – Amwittools International, a leading supplier of high-quality tools, has expanded its warehouse capacity with three additional Kardex Shuttles and the innovative Kardex Color Pick system. The company now operates nine Kardex Shuttles, spread across two U-shaped aisles. This expansion boosts logistical flexibility, increases processing speed, and keeps the error rate below 0.1%.

“This step demonstrates how scalable automation supports structural growth while ensuring flawless deliveries,” says Hans Zevenbergen, Sales Manager at Kardex Netherlands. “With this expansion, Amwittools is leveraging the full power of visual and digital order processing.”
